choices.C: Enable Link LDP on R4 and R6.
choices.A: Reset the LDP session between R4 and R6.
choices.B: Implement an LDP targeted session with R4 on R6.
choices.D: Configure LDP Session Protection on R4.

comments.content: The traffic between R4 and R5 should normally pass through R6. The best bet of answer is the comment from thejag. We know that R6 has session protection enabled but gets session recovery failure from R4. It may mean that R4 is not configured with session protection. E-Bit set, only means that there is a fatal error https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5036.html and is probably set due to hold time expired. I'll vote for Answer D

discussion.content: In my opinion these answers have no sense at all… Regarding answer D, no sure what would be the effect of configuring session protection on R4 to protect LDP session between R4 - R3 and R4 - R6 for failures between R3 - R6 and R6 – R5. Anyway, perhaps someone can explain it.
SP (session protection) is shown to be configured on R6 but "session recovery failed" for R4 so needs to be configured on R4.

Selected Answer: DE
DE are correct

Based on https://archive.nanog.org/meetings/nanog55/presentations/Sunday/Aldrin.pdf
– RFC 4379 use UDP port 3503 for LSP Ping

questions.question_text:
A network architect plans to implement MPLS OAM to provide additional troubleshooting functionality for the NOC team. After analyzing the configuration on the
MPLS P/PE nodes, the architect decides to revise the CoPP policies. Which two actions ensure that the new solution is secure? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Allow port 3505 in the outbound direction only.
choices.E: Allow port 3503 in the inbound direction only.
choices.C: Allow the TCP and UDP protocols.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Model-driven telemetry is a new approach for network monitoring in which data is streamed from network devices continuously using a push model and provides near real-time access to operational statistics.

questions.question_text: What is a feature of model-driven telemetry?

choices.B: It is less secure because it uses community strings.
choices.C: It uses the pull model to send requested data to a client when polled.
choices.D: It uses the push model to stream data to desired destinations.
choices.A: It occasionally streams to multiple servers in the network.

DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the descriptions from the left onto the corresponding OS types on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The link between Office A and Office B is running at 90% load, and occasionally the CPU on router R1 is overloaded. The company implemented QoS for business-critical applications at both offices as a temporary solution. A network engineer must update the R1 configuration to 600 ms to reduce CPU load and limit downtime after connection failure to avoid data loss. Which action meets this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A B And C are invalid commands

choices.A: Configure the fast-hello feature for OSPF with the command ip ospf dead-interval minimal hello-multiplier 3.
choices.D: Configure BFD echo mode with the command bfd interval 150 min_rx 200 multiplier 3.
choices.C: Configure BFD non-echo mode with the command echo interval 250 minimal 300 echo-multiplier 2.
choices.B: Configure BFD demand mode with the command bfd-demand timer 150 interval 250 retransmit 5.
